job_title: Anonymous Employee in Milton Keynes, England
pros: Paid holidays, nice kitchen, coffee machines, fruit in the morning......., poor performance goes unnoticed
cons:
Poor management, high turnover of perm and contractors, lack of accountability, what purpose do the projects serve? Does anyone actually want what the TSC is offering?
Managers who are out of their depth, trying to guide people in areas they have no expertise in.  Contractors in positions of power. 
I would summarise the TSC as self entitled. It purports to being this innovative organisation, in what? What impact has it delivered and to what market? The TSC is given money by Innovate UK and it wastes it. I've seen it first hand, if you want to take your foot off your career and catch a breath before you get back into meaningful work, try and land a gig at the TSC. You will go in with all the energy of the world, huffing and puffing, then after a period nothing happens. You become disillusioned, you contemplate your options, then think, this is easy money, like a high paid footballer sitting on the bench. It's a passive income. Strive for more.

review_title: A very small company that doesn't really know what it's supposed to be - there are better places to work
pros: Free car parking (with waiting list ), snazzy modern work space in central location, some friendly and very bright tech people, excellent salaries & package for tech staff without requiring work ethic of commercial company - civil service mentality, great work/life balance for some, flexible working for some, free coffee/tea
cons: Lack of progression, highly overpaid arrogant senior exec and managers with little idea of managing, poor direction from management, little adherence to company values by senior staff whilst expecting junior staff to tow the line, blatant wastage, correction shameful wastage of government funding, contractors staying for years on big money, poor value projects, no real innovation ideas, poor life work/balance for some, no flexible working for some varies wildly across teams, very high attrition rate of staff, bullying,. CEO is no longer Steve Yianni who really was a square peg in the wrong hole, the new CEO hasn't made much of an impression. Would agree with another review that poor performance is rewarded (that could be seen as a pro)
